ply by declaring that any student who works hard but does not get good
grades does not work hard enough.Finally, someone who says, “If you
think  it  over  thoroughly,  you  will  agree  with  me”  can  dismiss  anyone
who disagrees simply by denying that he thought it over thoroughly.Of
course, these terms—“true,” “real,” “thorough(ly),” and “enough“—do
not always make positions self-sealing. Nonetheless, these and other com-
